body.p:
Lexington
Dec 22d 1860
Hon Beriah Magoffin
Dear Sir

About six weeks or two months since, I was induced by the entreatie of a Widowed Mother to become the security for her son. on a Bond to keep the Peace -- since that time the Boy has broken the Peace and thereby forfeited the Bond -- I Know of no excuse of justification which can be set up in defense of the Deft conduct -- at the same time I can see
no advantage to accrue to the state by coercing from me the amount of the Bond viz $1500 -- Times are hard -- money scarce, I am poor, and the Union is divided, in veiw of these circumstances it is my candid opinion that this also is a case which strongly recommends itself to executive clemency -- Hoping that your Excellency may take the same view of the matter -- and send by mail a pPardon for your humble servant

I remain as Ever
Respectfully
Robt J Breckinridge

R. J. Breckinridge
Respite 12 mo
B, M
Lexington City Ct
$150 } Bail Bond
Issd Decr 24 1860
